CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1959, pg. 1, reads: "Harold Davis...saved children with hose. - Harris Photo."  Portions of related article read: "Mrs. Thomas was trapped and burned to death in rear cellar room.  However, all of her children and her husband, were evacuated from the blazing home.  The children are: Barbara, 14; Rheba Mae, 12, nicknamed 'Tanya'; Shirley, 11; Emaline, 10, and John Jr., 9. John Thomas Sr. is the father...The rescue of the children was largely due to the quick action of a next-door neighbor, Harold Davis, who unreeled 130-foot of garden hose, which he uses to wash his car, and began to water down the flames in parts of the house where they were greatest before firemen arrived..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Harold Davis wearing boots and standing next to hillside covered in snow
